metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23981 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A texture upload of a Pixel Buffer Object could have confused the WebGL code to skip binding the buffer used to unpack it, resulting in memory corruption and a potentially exploitable information leak or crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.9, Firefox < 87, and Thunderbird < 78.9.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23981` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required
